summary:
Table tennis, or ping-pong, is a fast-paced racket sport played on a table with a net in the middle. Players hit a small, hollow ball back and forth using rackets, aiming to make their opponent miss. It's a fun game for all ages and can be played indoors, which is why it's popular worldwide.

The sport has been in the Olympics since 1988, with different events for men and women. The International Table Tennis Federation (ITTF) makes the rules and has many member countries. Table tennis is easy to learn but needs quick reactions and good focus.
title: Table tennis
